commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It's finally over. I worked my brain so hard, I feel like I might pass out. It's over for me...

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: My brain's fried...

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: We've only just gotten through our first day of exams. We've got more exams coming up tomorrow, so we can't relax quite yet.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Can't do it... Brain, empty...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I've overworked my brain this much, and it's still not over? Just end me now.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I think I did better on these exams than I usually do. I worked really hard, so I'm gonna get some shut-eye now. Zzz...

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I'm sleepy, too.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: So, you think the study sessions worked?

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Absolutely!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I felt much more confident about my exams because of them.

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Yeah, I totally understand! Teaching others is a great way to review as well.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I wish we could just aim for an average of 60 instead of everyone needing to score 60 or more.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: I like the sound of that! That way, if someone scores 100, I can get away with 20!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You could put in a BIT more effort than that, Kasumi... So anyway, let's all aim for 60 or higher, guys!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: That hurdle is way too high.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I'd feel better if this were about our electives. I'd barely break a sweat trying to score a 60 in styling.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: There are styling exams in your life design course? That sure is different from the general curriculum.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Styling?! Wow! What other kinds of exams do you have?

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: We have to answer questions about fashion and draw up design sketches, that kind of thing.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: There are also exams about the history of fashion, and even hair and makeup.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: It sounds so fancy and fun!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I guess it is, but... It's still rather difficult, you know.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You're part of the life design course as well, aren't you, Kanata?

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Does that mean you come up with your own designs, too?

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Oh, I sure do. But mine are all food-based.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Food-based?

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yup! I chose food design, so I have nutritional science exams and that kind of stuff.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Oh, of course! I guess that makes sense since you're so good at cooking.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I wanna be sure I can make tasty boxed lunches for Haruka.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: You have shared some of your cooking with us when you've made too much before too. Your fried chicken was so buono!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: Oh my, I want to try some myself!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You're all in your element when it comes to your specialty subjects.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: I sure am, but I'm still pretty bad at science and math.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I can handle science and math, but Japanese is rough.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Haha... Uh, if I remember correctly, Shizuku and Emma are in the international exchange course, right?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Well, yes, but aside from choosing another language to study on top of Japanese, our course isn't really different from the general curriculum.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: I'm fine with foreign languages, it's Japanese that I find hard. I can speak it, but reading it is a whole other story. Hiragana, katakana, AND kanji? My brain's going to pop!

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: I understand why Emma chose the international exchange course, but what about you, Shizuku?

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: I want to be an actress on an international scale, so I wanted to study about different countries.

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: *Chuckle* If anyone can do it, it's you, Shizuku.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Yeah, I agree. So anyway, let's give it our best shot in tomorrow's exams!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: All right! I'm gonna take a little nap to get ready for tomorrow...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: No naps allowed, Kana!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Huh?

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: You need to cram as much as you can for tomorrow! You hear me?!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Whaaat?!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Th-This isn't like you at all, Ai!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Now's not the time to get lazy. Now get out your notes and books!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: C-Can't we take a little break first? I mean, we're all pretty exhausted after those tests...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Nope and nope! Time is of the essence! Shizuku! Physics is your worst subject, right? I'll teach you.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Don't you think you're being a bit too iron-fisted, Ai?

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: She's a demon... We have a demon amongst us... Rina-chan Board says, "Tremble!"

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: If being a demon is what it takes to keep us school idols, then so be it! Now pick up your pens and get to studying!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: *Whine* I don't have enough room in my brain for all this...

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Okay! I guess I'll have to MAKE some room for it!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: *Wail* Have mercy!
